children.subject:
What was the reason they gave you?
Last spring I could enroll in more because 20.5 was a soft cap at that time, but since it's a hard cap now I need to have my cap raised
Last spring it worked for me as well. I didn't go way over 20.5, but I did take 22--I think I got dropped and then readded for one of my classes. I'm not exactly sure how it worked LOL.
I was informed this was not possible last spring (and so just didn't get units for some stuff I was doing); but hopefully this has changed.

history.content:
LSCS students only can use this form to request an exception to the semester unit cap

https://docs.google.com/a/berkeley.edu/forms/d/13Lj5ndKKYUSmXjATjlNxDg2wKOM4LcRx2FAQKfTnxRQ/viewform?edit_requested=true#start=invite

Hi. I'm in the college of Letters and Science and would like to enroll in more than 20.5 units. I just declared CS as my major, though on my cal central it still shows my old advisor. Do I talk to my old advisor or one of the CS advisors to have my cap raised? I took more than 20.5 units my first two semesters at Cal and did relatively well, and I took less last semester because 20.5 units is a hard cap now.. :(, and my advisor wouldn't let me raise my cap until the third week, by which the additional class I wanted to enroll in had filled up. 

Does anyone know if it's possible to raise my cap BEFORE instruction starts or within the first week of school or so?
history.subject: Enrolling in more than 20.5 units
